byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and SEWELL CHAN
byline.contributor: Raphael Minder reported from Madrid, and Sewell Chan from London. Ivan Nechepurenko contributed reporting from Moscow, and Michael Wolgelenter from London.

lead_paragraph: The warships were en route to the Mediterranean to bolster the bombing campaign against the besieged Syrian city of Aleppo.

headline.print_headline: Russia Drops Plan to Fuel Warships at Spanish Port
headline.main: Russia Drops Bid to Dock Ships at Spanish Port as NATO Adds Pressure

snippet: The warships were en route to the Mediterranean to bolster the bombing campaign against the besieged Syrian city of Aleppo....
abstract: Russia withdraws its application to dock three warships for refueling at Spanish port of Ceuta, just after Spain's NATO partners call on country to turn vessels away given their involvement in military operations in Syria.
